name: privilege
posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an advantage that only one person or group of people has, usually because of their position or because they are rich
trans_examp.trans_cn: （特定个体或群体的）特权，特别待遇

example.eg: Healthcare should be a right, not a privilege.
example.egtrans: 医疗保健应该是权利，而非特权。

example.eg: Senior management enjoy certain privileges, such as company cars and health insurance.
example.egtrans: 高级管理层享受公司配车和私人医疗保健等特权。

trans_examp.trans_en: an opportunity to do something special or enjoyable

example.eg: I had the privilege of interviewing Picasso in the 1960s.
example.egtrans: 我在20世纪60年代很荣幸地采访到了毕加索。

example.eg: It was a real privilege to meet her.
example.egtrans: 见到她真是莫大的荣幸。

trans_examp.trans_en: the way in which rich people or people from a high social class have most of the advantages in society
trans_examp.trans_cn: （富人或有权势者的）特权，特别待遇

trans_examp.trans_en: the special right that some people in authority have that allows them to do or say things that other people are not allowed to
